description.narrative: MCT is a non statutory national media body that exists to enhance media profession, code of ethics, influences policies, legislations and practices in Tanzania. Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Switzerand supported MCT's 2007-2011 Programme Strategy. Whereas, only Sweden Switzerland and Norway will support the 2012-2015.

MCT är en frivillig självregulerande nationell instans för att öka kvaliteten I medierapportering, stärka yrkesetik samt påverka lagstiftning och praxis för fria medier i Tanzania. Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Switzerand stödde MCT 2007-2011 Program strategi. Sverige, Schweiz och Norge kommer att stödja 2012-2015.

Media Council of Tanzania (MCT) has two overall objectives: 1) to promote freedom of expression and media and 2) t achieve quality in media by promoting quality standards, accountability, social responsibility and skills development.

description.narrative: A few milestones in achievements of impact should be highlighted:- The influence MCT has posed in setting the accepted national journalism curriculums standard have been an great achievement of more formative type. - MCT contributed effectively to get press freedom into the proposed draft Constitution. The proosed draft Constitution is however, in its totality, assessed as less progressive as it for example maintains some of the powers to the excessive powers to the executive. - Number of members have more than doubled over the period with an increase from 94 to 204. - Compliance rates of cases for arbitration and mediation referred to MCT remained high (90%) but the number of complaints remained low throughout the implementation period. - Monitoring of media ethics has been overshadowed by other tasks and the press freedom violation registry was not found to be very effective as it missed out on a potential bigger number of violations that are not reported. Improvements has since been done to the register to better capture violations. The declining trend (rom 2013) has clearly made a steep turn to the worse from 2016. - Despite constant lobbying and networking over the years about having the repressive News Paper Act from 1976 replaced with a more conducive legislation, the legislation eventually passed (Media Service Act 2016) entails enlarged control of content as well as journalists and media houses. Political will overruled the many years of lobbying activities. On Zanzibar the rates the lobbying has been more fruitful and a MCT proposal are at present constituting the media law review on the islands. The separation of Media legislation nd Access to information was also a gain from the advocacy work undertaken by MCT and others under the umbrella of CORI (Coalition to the Right to Information) chaired of MCT. The improvements of the Access to Information Act, 2016 (compared to the first reading of the Bill) can be contributed to CORI.- MCT at earlier stages nurtured the formation of TEF and UTPC which are now independent organisations working for press freedom within editors and active journalists in the field. These actors are increasingly important as the media environment worsen. The addition of Tanzania Media Foundation, working on grant making for investigative journalism, has complemented the landscape of media actors.
